newsitem.title: GERMANY: New data put German net EU payment at 82 pct - paper.
newsitem.headline: New data put German net EU payment at 82 pct - paper.

text.p: New calculations of European Union nations' net contributions to the EU budget show Germany made far and above the highest payments in 1996, the German daily Handelsblatt said on Thursday.

In a summary of a report due for publication on Friday, the newspaper said that according to new European Commission data, Germany contributed 81.9 percent to the EU in 1996, while the Netherlands contributed 9.3 percent and Sweden 4.1 percent.
Until now, official EU calculations had put German payments at around 50 to 60 percent of contributions, the report said.

Ingrid Matthaeus-Maier, a fiscal expert in Germany's Social Democrat (SPD) party, told the newspaper the new data, which calculate net figures, were proof that Bonn's EU contributions were out of proportion and should be cut.
